greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = 1 + A051903(A003415(n)) - A051903(n), a(1) = 0 by convention.
comment: All terms are nonnegative because taking the arithmetic derivative (A003415) of n may decrease its "degree" (i.e., its maximal exponent, A051903) by at most one, and in many cases may also increase it, or keep it same.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
xref: Cf. A328320 (indices of zeros), A328321 (of nonzero terms).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 13 2019
